decision_conditions: It is recommended that the Oak tree T1 and the two Horse chestnut trees, which are part of the group G1 on the Havering TPO plans 4/14 can have only their overhanging canopies reduced by up to 30% from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the trees balanced, for light and general maintenance purposes.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.

It is suggested that you engage the services of a qualified and fully insured tree surgeon to carry out the above work on your behalf (you should ask to see the contractor's insurance certificate and make sure that it is up to date).
description: - It's a chestnut tress which has over grown to our fence and needs pruning. We are only planning to trim on our side and have consulted our neighbours as well. The Tree surgeon suggest we can trim 30% of branches over grown to our place.
